SEARCH
Package gov.cdc.izgateway.xform.endpoints.fhir

Class IDIMatch

java.lang.Object
gov.cdc.izgateway.xform.endpoints.fhir.IDIMatch
public class IDIMatch extends Object
This class implements the IDI Match Scoring Algorithm described in the HL7 Interoperable Digital Identity and Patient Matching FHIR implementation guide.
Author:
Audacious Inquiry
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • idTypeMatches

      public static boolean idTypeMatches(org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.CodeableConcept idType, List<String> types)
      Determines whether the identifier type matches one of the HL7 codes for identifier type systems.
      Parameters:
      idType - The type of the identifier
      types - The set of identifier types to check for
      Returns:
      True if one of the codes in idType matches one of the codes in types.

    • doIdentifiersMatch

      public static boolean doIdentifiersMatch(List<org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Identifier> search, List<org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Identifier> found, String... type)
      Reports on where there is a match on two identifiers in search and found lists.
      Parameters:
      search - The list of identifiers being searched for
      found - The list of identifiers found
      type - The types of identifiers to check.
      Returns:
      true if there is a match.

    • idComparator

      public static int idComparator(org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Identifier id1, org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Identifier id2)
      Compares the system and value of two identifiers for a match. NOTE: This method performs a case insensitive match b/c for systems, it case is non-essential variation, and few if any identifier systems will care about case either. Those that do (e.g., in base-64 encoded hashes of random values) will be extremely UNLIKELY to collide, whereas the chance of human error for using lowercase letters where uppercase are required is much higher and creates an excess of false MIS-matches. None of the idTypes used by this class ever use base-64 encoding or anything similar.
      Parameters:
      id1 - The first identifier
      id2 - The second identifier
      Returns:
      true if the system and value match, false otherwise.

    • last4Comparator

      public static int last4Comparator(org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Identifier id1, org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Identifier id2)
      Compares the last 4 characters (digits) of identifiers.
      Parameters:
      id1 - The first identifier
      id2 - The second identifier
      Returns:
      true if the last four characters match.

    • doesNameMatch

      public static boolean doesNameMatch(List<org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.HumanName> search, List<org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.HumanName> found)
      Checks for a given/family name match. Two names match if their given names are equivalent and the family name matches. This is a case insensitive match. Hyphens are treated as being equivalent to spaces.
      Parameters:
      search - The list of names to match
      found - The list of names found
      Returns:
      true if at least one pair of names match from search and found

    • stringsMatch

      public static boolean stringsMatch(String search, String found)
      Compares two strings for a match. This is a case-insensitive match. Two strings are considered to be a match if they are within an edit distance of one of each other where 0 = no change, and 1 = a single deletion, insertion, replacement, or transposition. This uses the Apache Text Levenshtein Distance metric implementation and checks afterwards for transposition errors using brute force in that special case.
      Parameters:
      search - The strings being sought
      found - The strings that was found
      Returns:
      true if the two strings match.

    • doMiddleNamesMatch

      public static boolean doMiddleNamesMatch(List<org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.HumanName> search, List<org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.HumanName> found)
      Compare two human names to see if names after the first given name (i.e., the middle names) match.
      Parameters:
      search - The name or names being sought.
      found - The name or names that were found.
      Returns:
      true if the middle names match in one pairing.

    • doesAddressMatch

      public static boolean doesAddressMatch(List<org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Address> search, List<org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Address> found)
      See if the found addresses match the searched for address.
      Parameters:
      search - The address being searched for
      found - The address or addresses found
      Returns:
      True if the address matches

    • statesMatch

      public static boolean statesMatch(String search, String found)
      Determines if state names or abbreviations match. NOTE: This only works for states, provinces or territories of the US, Canada and Mexico.
      Parameters:
      search - The sought after state or state abbreviation
      found - The found state or state abbreviation
      Returns:
      true if they two represent the same state (or province)

    • countriesMatch

      public static boolean countriesMatch(org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Address s, org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Address f)
      Compare two countries for a match. Will match a country name or alias with it's two or three-letter ISO code.
      Parameters:
      s - The sought for country
      f - The found country
      Returns:
      true if the two match

    • zipsMatch

      public static boolean zipsMatch(String search, String found)
      Compare two zip codes for equivalence
      Parameters:
      search - The sought after postal code
      found - The found postal code
      Returns:
      true if the first five digits match (e.g., US, Mexico) or if non-numeric (e.g., Canada) and the strings (sans spaces) match.

    • doesDobMatch

      public static boolean doesDobMatch(Date search, Date found)
      Compares two dates for a match
      Parameters:
      search - The sought for date
      found - The found date
      Returns:
      true if the two dates match

    • doesTelecomMatch

      public static boolean doesTelecomMatch(List<org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.ContactPoint> search, List<org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.ContactPoint> found, org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.ContactPoint.ContactPointSystem system)
      Generic method to compare two ContactPoint lists to see if there is a match
      Parameters:
      search - The sought after ContactPoint
      found - The found ContactPoint
      system - The type of ContactPoint to check for
      Returns:
      true if at least one pair matches

    • doesZipMatch

      public static boolean doesZipMatch(List<org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Address> search, List<org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Address> found)
      Check two lists of addresses for a zip-code match
      Parameters:
      search - The sought after addresses
      found - The found addresses
      Returns:
      true if one pair in sought and found have a matching zip code

    • score

      public static void score(org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Bundle b, IDIMatch.PatientMatchParameters match)
      Score the results in the bundle. Scores the results in the bundle by comparing each returned patient against searchPatient and scoring according to the FHIR Interoperable and Digital Identity Patient Matching guide.
      Parameters:
      b - The bundle to score
      match - The patient being searched for
      See Also:
      • Scoring Matches
